publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-909 Donald Gorrie: Post Office Pension Fund—That the Parliament notes that the Post Office has responded to a surplus in its pension fund by giving itself a contributions holiday for the past 13 years instead of using the windfall to improve the position of its pensioners; regrets that the corporation should follow worst industry practice in this respect and urges Post Office pension fund trustees to review their policy.

S1M-909 Donald Gorrie: Post Office Pension Fund—That the Parliament notes that the Post Office has responded to a surplus in its pension fund by giving itself a contributions holiday for the past 13 years instead of using the windfall to improve the position of its pensioners; regrets that the corporation should follow worst industry practice in this respect, and urges Post Office pension fund trustees to review their policy. Supported by: Michael Russell*
S1M-909 Post Office Pension Fund (lodged on 24 May 2000) Nora Radcliffe*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*
S1M-909 Post Office Pension Fund (lodged on 24 May 2000) Alex Neil*, Christine Grahame*

S1M-909 Donald Gorrie: Post Office Pension Fund-That the Parliament notes that the Post Office has responded to a surplus in its pension fund by giving itself a contributions holiday for the past 13 years instead of using the windfall to improve the position of its pensioners; regrets that the corporation should follow worst industry practice in this respect, and urges Post Office pension fund trustees to review their policy. Supported by: Michael Russell, Nora Radcliffe, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Alex Neil, Christine Grahame
